str2: If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A hand.

word: causes you to fall into sin,
parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From skandalon; to entrap, i.e. Trip up (transitively) or entice to sin, apostasy or displeasure).

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From apo and kopto; to amputate; reflexively to mutilate.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
Crippled, lame, especially in the hands. From the same as kulioo; rocking about, i.e. Crippled.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Two. A primary numeral; 'two'.
A hand.
From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Of Hebrew origin; valley of Hinnom; ge-henna, a valley of Jerusalem, used as a name for the place of everlasting punishment.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Inextinguishable, unquenchable. Not extinguished, i.e. perpetual.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.
